name: Queen of the Valley Inn

reviews.title: Great New Year's Eve Celebration
reviews.text: We decided to spend a quieter New Year's Eve than normal. We met some wonderful people visiting the area and our hosts were extremely accomodating. The house is wonderfully charming with an old world feel, to say nothing of the comfort of their bed. To top off our visit we were welcomed into the new year with a delicious breakfast of scrambled eggs with lobster and fresh tyhme. (people asked why the eggs were so yellow and our hosts said they come fresh each day from across the street) The breakfast was started with small pancakes that were mixed with ricotta cheese for a light texture and a fresh, warm fruit compote. We will be going back.

reviews.title: New Owners and WOW, a slice of heaven!
Farm house elegance
reviews.text: What a wonderful, quiet, country setting and yet close to quaint La Conner for an artful experience.

reviews.title: Loved Queen of the Valley B&B
reviews.text: This is the second year in a row that 7 of us have stayed at Queen of the Valley Inn in LaConner. Shelly and Chris are wonderful hosts, the food is fantastic and service is outstanding. They went out of their way to make us feel comfortable including a never ending coffee pot. They made arrangements for dinner reservations, spa therapy or what ever our hearts desired.
The rooms are generous in size, nice bathroom, and special little touches like "spa robes' so that you can lounge around and have a relaxing breakfast.
reviews.title: Queen of the Valley indeed!!
A Crown Jewel in La Conner
reviews.text: Very close to the downtown area.

reviews.title: Excellent get-away!
reviews.text: We just enjoyed a memorable family weekend at the Queen of the Valley Inn in La Conner, WA.

I've traveled all over the world, and stayed at top properties everywhere (Danielli in Venice, Hassler in Rome, The Oriental in Bankgok etc.) but my experience with B&B's is limited to a short stay on a sheep farm in the Cotswalds. However, I take an annual class at La Conner Art Workshops and the house I normally rent is just too big for me, so I decided to give the Queen a try for five nights in July. Shelly, the innkeeper, is a delight and her breakfasts are fabulous. She buys everything from nearby farms, so it is all fresh, organic and seasonal. Fresh berries, peaches, and to die for waffles. I stayed in the spacious Hong Kong room, with a nice view of nearby farms, fields and sunrises. HUGE private bathroom with a comfy big old tub made my end of the day painting aches and pains float away. Decor is ecletic with great antiques and touches of gold throughout. Wonderful fireplace; can only imagine it in the winter. Photos don't do this place justice; it's a 1908 charmer which is located a short walk to LaConner's hot spots including a nice casual restaurant Seeds, one of my favs.
reviews.title: Queen for a Week

likes.liked: — This is a tough one. A tie between bathtub, breakfast and bed!

reviews.text: We had a great time at the Queen of the Valley Inn. We immediately felt at home in this historic three story charming bed and breakfast. Shelly, the innkeeper, is a gracious host who welcomed us, supplied us with information on local attractions and personally offered us whatever we needed. She spent time visiting with us and telling us about the history of the house and recent events. We enjoyed a full hot breakfast served to our table. The food was fresh, healthy, and fantastic, among the best I have ever had. In the peace and quiet of the Inn, we woke refreshed and ready to continue our visit of the northwest. It was a perfect visit!
reviews.title: Great hospitality at the Queen

likes.liked: — the inviting atmosphere where we were instantly at ease

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I regularly sneak out of West Seattle for the great experience of the Skagit Valley. To begin with - neither of our two favorite summer beverages (Pasek Cellar's Chardonnay or Tulip Valley's Sweetie Pie Cider) can be bought outside the greater Mount Vernon market. The cool thing - you can easily hit both these wineries before your stay at the Queen. Just take exit 221 for Pasek and they'll help you with any other directions from there!
reviews.title: Awesome off island adventure

reviews.text: Yesterday was the best of our half dozen northern treks - as we left home figuring we'd come back home (didn't pack to stay overnight) - and ended up finding this great little lodging secret just outside La Conner. We end up downtown La Conner at Hellam's wine shop - talking to Jeff (the owner) and tasting latest of his visitors (Dakota Creek winery out of Blaine - Great Syrah!). We drop the hint to him we'd just as soon stay the night in La Conner and quickly he jumped on the phone. Pretty soon he's handing us the phone with one of his fellow chamber of commerce members on the line - that has one bed and breakfast room left.
reviews.title: Love those Beds!

likes.liked: — What I liked best about the accommodation was the food, the beds, and the surrounding area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm usually a little skeptical of the "one room left" line - but in this case we were the lucky couple to snag a great room in this awesome bed and breakfast. There's not many rooms, making it a more intimate experience, but with a nice central area is you want to meet other travelers (or especially if you rented the place completely out with friends?) Our room was nice, had an awesome bed, and our own shower facility (an added b&b bonus).
reviews.title: Warm, Friendly, and Wonderful

likes.liked: — The bed was very comfortable and the decor was excellent.
likes.disliked: — Could have had brighter reading lights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ratings are all relative, and we give the Queen a "very good" versus an "excellent" rating based on bed and breakfast stays at other places in North America. The Queen of the Valley has a nice ambiance based on its early history. Chris and Shelley are indeed a welcoming couple.
reviews.title: An okay place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed we had was excellent. The breakfast was good and consisted of cottage cheese pancakes served with whipped cream, strawberries and bacon. Relative to breakfasts at other bed and breakfast's, we find some the Tripavisor reviewers' ratings as "food to die for" a bit overstated.
reviews.title: Charming Inn
The coziest, most welcoming place I've stayed in quite a while.
reviews.text: Our one disappointment was the lack of warm water to take a shower during the early evening (probaby the jacuzzi suite took all the hot water).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved La Conner and highly recommend a visit to this unique town. The Queen of the Valley is an acceptable choice for accommodation.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation to relax, see the sights and eat well!

reviews.text: Spent two nights at this very charming & peaceful inn. We stayed in the Hong Kong room which has a king size bed with an eastern exposure. Seeing the sun come up over the mountains from the bed is a nice way to start the day. The bathroom is very large & there is also a walk through closet connecting the two rooms. The breakfasts were delicious both days. The innkeepers Chris & Shelley were both very friendly and made us feel very welcome. You do not need to bring any reading material because you will find books & magazines available in the room. I would certainly stay here again on future trips to the Skagit Valley.
reviews.title: Tranquillity and More

likes.liked: — tranquile setting but many things to do in the town Mount Vernon which is very close by.

description: Located just outside the town of La Conner and surrounded by farmland, The Queen of the Valley Inn is the perfect antidote to urban life. The Queen offers the ultimate in privacy, comfort, luxury amenities and home-cooked breakfasts. Come visit and find out why the Lonely Planet Guidebook 2008/9 listed The Queen as a Lonely Planet "Pick" and called her "Memorable."
